reviewText: Ah the last disk in the series. I gotta say this one probably has the best episodes on it. My favorite one being "Night of the Rogues" where Shredder hires all of the turtles toughest enemies to take them out. The magic is really in these episodes and the shows humor.Again the special features are on the crap side but the episodes more then make up for that. I wasn't counting on getting any special features cause we haven't been getting them really so I can't complain too much.If your a fan of old or new, you want to remember the turtles, get this set it's great.

reviewText: For the 25th Anniversary of TMNT, LionsGate released Season 7 in four part DVDs.Season 7 Part 4 Episodes are:Night of the RoguesRevenge of the FlyDirk Savages: Mutant Hunter!Combat LandAtlantis AwakensInvasion of the KrangazoidsShredder Triumphant!The special feature is A Shellabration of a Fan-Nomenon Sensation: Devoted and Die-Hard TMNT Fans Speak!I only bought the season in four parts so I could get the the miniature TMNT toys. I recommend others to buy theTeenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Complete Season 7 Set.

reviewText: Greetings, fellow Turtle fans and pizza lovers!  :)  The 7 episodes featured on this DVD are from the year 1993, and they are the final episodes that aired before the designers went in a completely new/darker direction on Seasons 8 through 10.  The episodes listed here are Episodes #162, and #165 through #170.  I will now review each episode.Episode #162:  The Turtles get a call from April O'Neil about a break-in at the City Hall of Records.  And who do the Turtles find -- none other than Shredder, Krang, Bebop and Rocksteady.  After the T.M.N.T. foil their latest plan, Shredder becomes irate and decides that his next course of action is to recruit 7 minions from all over the galaxy/Earth to stop the Turtles.  So he enlists the Rat King, Slash (the evil Turtle from Dimension X), Leatherhead, Tempestra (she was in Episode #98 and tormented poor Leonardo), Scumbug (a new minion), Antrax (Krang's royal executioner from Dimension X), and finally, the return of Chrome Dome! (he was featured in Episodes #126 and #127).  Shredder plans to keep the Turtles busy with the super villains while himself, Krang, and the Foot Soldiers dig up a huge ship just filled with treasure!  How will the T.M.N.T. stop Shredder AND make work of those nasty villains??  Stay tuned to find out!  :)Episode #165:  Baxter Stockman, The Fly, returns!  :)  The very awesome and multi-talented Pat Fraley not only voices Krang, but he also voices Baxter.  The episode starts off with Vernon Fenwick intentionally revealing the location of some mutagen.  Although Krang and Shredder don't find out, the T.M.N.T. still decide to stake out the building.  Meanwhile, in the Technodrome, Krang has his own problems -- he can't open a portal to Dimension X to get some needed equipment.  Instead, he accidentally opens the portal to the dimensional limbo -- where he last imprisoned Baxter Stockman!!  :(Baxter and his computer -- now just a circuit chip -- (see Episode #80 for the computer's last appearance) make short work of Shredder, Krang, and the Foot Soldiers.  Baxter finally gets the upper hand (after 5 other attempts in previous episodes) and uses his computer to take control of the Technodrome!  Next, Baxter imprisons Shredder and company inside a climate-controlled room.  How will they get out??  :(Baxter and his computer go to the surface to steal the mutagen that Vernon earlier revealed.  Baxter not only acquires the mutagen, but steals the Super Slosher 2000 (meant to put out fires) to use against the NYC citizens!  He turns all of them into various insects.  He even goes after April O'Neil, Irma and Vernon at Channel 6!!  It will take a lot of wits for the T.M.N.T. to stop Baxter and turn everyone back to normal.  This will also be Baxter's final episode in the entire series, so stay tuned to what evil fate awaits him!!Episode #166:  Please see my review of the VHS episode, "Shredder Triumphant!"Episode #167:  2 mutants roam the streets -- Tokka and Rahzar.  They create havoc at the Crystal Mall.  The T.M.N.T. try to stop them, to no avail.  Even worse, a rogue anti-mutant agent is set out to destroy ALL mutants, including the Turtles!  :(  He decides to capture 2 of the Turtles' longtime friends, Napoleon Bonafrog and Genghis Frog.  The anti-mutant agent places collar bracelets on them, which forces them to obey their master, whom happens to be a very hideous slug creature.  Even April and Irma get caught up in the drama and get their own collar bracelets forced on them.  The T.M.N.T. decide to list the help of Michaelangelo's longtime friend, Mondo Gecko (his previous appearance was in Episode #108 from Season 5).  It will take a lot of cunning to stop the slug creature and get the rogue anti-mutant agent to see the Turtles' good side.Episode #168:  This is one of Pat Fraley's best episodes from the entire season.  It's this one episode where he does the lion's share of voiceover work compared to everyone else's.  This episode ALSO has one of the most awesome soundtracks ever once you start watching it.  :)After Bebop and Rocksteady fail to steal some materials from Lightfoot Heavy Industries (thanks to the T.M.N.T., once again), Krang decides that he's had ENOUGH and decides to do the job himself.  So his ultimate, evil plan is to create 6 clones of himself!  However, the Krang clones immediately go rogue.  Krang decides to show them who's the REAL boss, then he orders them to steal parts for his new Thermo-Nuclear Generator, which he intends to use to re-energize his Technodrome.When the T.M.N.T. discover what happened, they quickly lose to the Krang clones.  So they have to regroup, and decide to take out one clone at a time.  But, little do they realize that the Krang clones have actually started to grow bodies!  Not only that, but Krang can't control them anymore!  The clones decide to use the materials for their OWN evil purpose -- by turning NYC into their OWN version of Dimension X!  And if that's not bad enough, Shredder's mutants had implanted a small teleportation device into April's camera, causing both her and Leonardo to get transported to a local zoo, where they are captured by Shredder himself.  It's up to the T.M.N.T. once again to stop both him and the Krang clones from overtaking the city!Episode #169:  The T.M.N.T. get invited to an amusement park, referred to as Combat Land.  But they don't realize what they are in for.  Horatio Stressbar, the owner of the park, orders the Turtles to give up their weapons and use some fake ones.  Once they start battling Horatio's robots, they immediately realize that something is wrong.  The robots actually have REAL weapons, and they quickly capture poor, unsuspecting Michaelangelo.  Not only that, but they make a clone of him.  Leonardo finds out about it the hard way when he, too, gets captured and cloned.  :(Even Vernon and Irma get tossed into the foray and are imprisoned inside a room.  But Horatio's ULTIMATE plan is to use his robots to blow up the sewers.  He intends to force City Hall to fork him over millions of bucks so that he can not only rebuild the sewers, but become filthy rich in the process!  So it's up to April and the rest of the T.M.N.T. to foil his tepid, useless plans.Episode #170:  Please see my VHS review of "Shredder Triumphant!"These 7 episodes are actually some of my favorites overall.  Each season kept getting better and better.  And although I do recommend that all of you buy this DVD, there's a MUCH better way.  Why not order (from Amazon, naturally) the 4 DVD disc set, which features ALL of Season 7??  It's comprised of Episodes #144 through #170, and it's much cheaper!  So now -- it's pizza time!!  :)

reviewText: I'm sorry, but I didn't really like the European Vacation episodes, so I don't plan on buying the Leonardo & Michelangelo Slices, but I'm definitely getting the Donatello & Raphael ones.  I got this one first because it contains my favorite episodes of the season.Here's a review of the episodes here.  The synopsizes come from Wikipedia.163. Night of the Rogues:  In an attempt to finally defeat the Turtles once and for all, Shredder assembles Leatherhead, Tempestra, Scumbug, Chrome Dome, Antrax, The Rat King and Slash to form a team that proves too much for the TMNT.  This is an incredible episode.  It's amazing they got all these villains together in one story.  Leatherhead has a new voice, which is annoying considering the fact that Jim Cummings would turn up again only 2 episodes later as Dirk Savage Mutant Hunter, but that's the only complaint I have about this episode.  I'm especially happy they brought Tempestra back.  The episode where she first appeared was always one of my favorites.  A+164.  Revenge of the Fly: Baxter Stockman & his alien computer return to Earth from the Dimensional Limbo & take possession of Shredder's Retro-Mutagen Ray Gun.  After stealing the essences of various insects & arachnids, he uses them to turn people into mutant insects & arachnids. The Turtles must battle the creatures & turn the people back to normal.  Baxter Stockman's appearances as the Fly are almost always excellent, & he makes his final one count.  A+165.  Dirk Savage Mutant Hunter:  When too many mutants roam New York, professional mutant hunter Dirk Savage is hired to round them up.  A fantastic episode with great characters, including Tokka & Rahzar from TMNT II: Secret of the Ooze.  Needless to say, no Vanilla Ice in sight as well as personalities for the 2 evil mutants make this episode superior to the movie.  A+166.  Combat Land: A new amusement theme park has opened with Shogun, Medieval & Future themed attractions. The Turtles are invited to try out the attractions, but when the robots in the park start to play too rough, the Turtles are in big trouble.  The worst episode on the disc.  It's good, but not spectacular.  B167.  Atlantis Awakens: The Turtles discover an Atlantean city, not in ancient Greece, but in modern times. After meeting a merman who, in reality is the true King of Atlantis, the Turtles must defeat Shredder & dethrone Bebop, who been set up as a puppet king.  There was an episode before this in the European Vacation series that dealt with Atlantis, & it was terrible.  I guess someone wanted to make a good episode with Atlantis, & this was a success.  A+168.  Invasion of the Krangazoids: In order to defeat the Turtles, Krang creates 6 clones of himself to deal with them. But, when the clones start to think for themselves & Krang loses control, the Turtles must save the city.  Another great episode.  A169.  Shredder Triumphant!:  After bringing the Technodrome back to the surface, Shredder and Krang trap the Turtles and send them to Dimension X where they become slaves. In the meantime, Shredder and Krang back on Earth once again try to take over the world.  This is an excellent & exciting finale to the season.  A+A delicious slice indeed.
summary: My favorite Turtle gets my favorite Season 7 episodes attached to his name.

reviewText: I really like the teenage mutant ninja turtles, even after all these years.Anyway I'm too old for the show but what the hell, anyway the show starts off season one the punks(including 2 guys name bebop an rocksteady), tries going after April, but the turtles stop the thugs an splinter tells the story of himself beinging a human an then turns into a rat, an turtles from regular into mutant turtles.You get the picture.On revenge of the fly episode they made a mistake at the end of it by not using the mutant gun on splinter to restore himself to human but did turn vernon spider an april wasp back to normal.Splinter wasnt even in the Revenge of the fly episode.But on last episode splinter did help the turtles...by stop bebop an rocksteady from trying to make april an others fall off the building(last episode of season 7)The big mistake the made from end of 7th season to 8th....Is Krang had his robot body with him when the turtles rid the technodrome, but on 1st episode of season 8. Krang had the bubble walker not robot body.An they didnt showed krangs body till end of season 10 on how they gotr rid of Dregg.An some mistakes the writers made on TMNT's..end of season 1 the rest of Rocksteady and Bebop gang are mutants in technodrome prison but mid season 3 they come back on the gangs all here episode but they weren't in the technodrome(trapped some where)An Baxter had the computer guy with him on son return of the fly(season 4), season 5(baxter didn't even had the computer with him on landlord of the flies), season 7(revenge of the fly), baxter did had the alien computer from season 4...thats the other mistake.Anyway it's just a cartoon anyway, the writers made some mistakes an didn't go by 100% on the schematics of the show.

reviewText: This DVD collects episodes 21-27 from season 7 of the 1987 TMNT series. As part of the franchise's 25th Anniversary, the season is being released across 4 individual DVDs, each attributed to a different Turtle (this is the 'Raphael slice.')I had 'outgrown' the original TMNT cartoon sometime after season 4, so a lot of the later seasons present totally new material for me. Viewing this for the first time without the nostalgic factor, all I can fairly say is "It is what it is." Much like Transformers and some of the other 80s/early 90s mainstays, if you didn't grow up with this stuff then the stilted animation, cheesy dialogue and watered down action won't do much for you. The plus side of these episodes is that they include a fair number of villains and hero guest stars, including Baxter Stockman, Rat King, Leatherhead, Scumbug, Casey Jones, and Merdude. Plus this set also includes the season finale,  which is usually where the show changed up its status quo a bit as it prepared for the next season.The set also includes a 10-min special feature on 'hardcore' TMNT fans. There are three of them, and they range from tolerable to embarrassing. I appreciate what they're trying to do here, but no fan wants to compare themselves to a fat chick that obsesses over Ninja Turtles. Fandom's not always a pretty thing.So like previous releases there are no restorations on video/audio, though the source quality looks okay. My dvd actually didn't come with a figurine, so not every set is a collector's pack. If you like this show this disc is a good buy, though with the upcoming TMNT: Smash-Up game, there are others ways to celebrate 25 years of Turtles.
